list_definition.definition: to look at or think about with wicked pleasure

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He gloated over his rival’s failure.

list_ex_of_english: In it, he gloated over the play being kept from performance and stated that the government did not accept the play.
Gloating is contrary to my nature.
He wants it to limp along into a failure over which he can gloat.
As with any major football rivalry, gloating and banter between the two sets of fans, many of whom work and even live together, is commonplace.
Here was an opportunity for the coalowners of this country to show real harmonious cooperation, and they came along and secured their full pound of flesh, and gloated over it.
There is no gloating about it.
I do not gloat over these failures.
